title: 2020–21 Liga TDP season
text:
The 2020–21 Liga TDP season is the fourth-tier <a href="Association%20football">football</a> league of <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>. The tournament began on 25 September 2020 and finished on 3 July 2021.
Competition format.
The Tercera División (Third Division) is divided into 14 groups. For the 2009/2010 season, the format of the tournament has been reorganized to a home and away format, which all teams will play in their respective group. The 14 groups consist of teams which are eligible to play in the liguilla de ascenso for two promotion spots, teams who are affiliated with teams in the <a href="Liga%20MX">Liga MX</a>, <a href="Liga%20de%20Expansi%C3%B3n%20MX">Liga de Expansión MX</a> and <a href="Liga%20Premier%20de%20M%C3%A9xico">Liga Premier</a> and development teams, which are not eligible for promotion but will play that who the better team in a sixteen team filial playoff tournament for the entire season.
The league format allows participating franchises to rent their place to another team, so some clubs compete with a different name than the one registered with the <a href="Mexican%20Football%20Federation">FMF</a>.
Due to the suspension of the previous season, for the 2020–21 season there will be four promotions to the Liga Premier. Two to Serie A and two to Serie B.
Group 1.
Group with 12 teams from <a href="Campeche">Campeche</a>, <a href="Quintana%20Roo">Quintana Roo</a>, <a href="Tabasco">Tabasco</a> and <a href="Yucat%C3%A1n">Yucatán</a>. Note: Delfines Márquez was announced as a participant for the season, but was excluded from the league after week 15 for failing to fulfill his obligations as an affiliated club. 
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 2.
Group with 15 teams from <a href="Puebla">Puebla</a> and <a href="Veracruz">Veracruz</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 3.
Group with 10 teams from <a href="Chiapas">Chiapas</a> and <a href="Oaxaca">Oaxaca</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 4.
Group with 20 teams from <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a> and <a href="Greater%20Mexico%20City">Greater Mexico City</a>. Note: Promodep Central was enrolled in the season, but the team was retired after week 23.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 5.
Group with 14 teams from <a href="Mexico%20City">Mexico City</a> and <a href="State%20of%20Mexico">State of Mexico</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 6.
Group with 12 teams from <a href="Guerrero">Guerrero</a>, Mexico City, <a href="Morelos">Morelos</a>, Puebla and State of Mexico.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 7.
Group with 16 teams from <a href="Hidalgo%20%28state%29">Hidalgo</a>, Mexico City, Puebla, State of Mexico and <a href="Tlaxcala">Tlaxcala</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 8.
Group with 19 teams from <a href="Guanajuato">Guanajuato</a>, <a href="Jalisco">Jalisco</a>, <a href="Michoac%C3%A1n">Michoacán</a> and <a href="Quer%C3%A9taro">Querétaro</a>. Note: Limsoccer F.C. was enrolled in the season, but was expelled after week 6 for failing to fulfill its obligations as an affiliate.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 9.
Group with 13 teams from <a href="Aguascalientes">Aguascalientes</a>, <a href="Durango">Durango</a>, Guanajuato, <a href="Jalisco">Jalisco</a>, <a href="Michoac%C3%A1n">Michoacán</a>, <a href="San%20Luis%20Potos%C3%AD">San Luis Potosí</a> and <a href="Zacatecas">Zacatecas</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 10.
Group with 20 teams from <a href="Colima">Colima</a> and <a href="Jalisco">Jalisco</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 11.
Group with 17 teams from Jalisco, <a href="Nayarit">Nayarit</a> and <a href="Sinaloa">Sinaloa</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 12.
Group with 8 teams from <a href="Coahuila">Coahuila</a>, <a href="Nuevo%20Le%C3%B3n">Nuevo León</a> and <a href="Tamaulipas">Tamaulipas</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 13.
Group with 8 teams from <a href="Chihuahua%20%28state%29">Chihuahua</a> and <a href="Sonora">Sonora</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Group 14.
Group with 7 teams from <a href="Baja%20California">Baja California</a>. Although this group was officially announced by the League, no match was ever played between its members. The three places that belonged to this group in the play-offs were awarded to the three clubs with the best coefficient in the North Zone and who could not qualify through their own group. 
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Promotion Play–offs.
The Promotion Play–offs will consist of seven phases. Classify 64 teams, the number varies according to the number of teams in each group, being between three and eight clubs per group. The country will be divided into two zones: South Zone (Groups I to VII) and North Zone (Groups VIII to XIII). Eliminations will be held according to the average obtained by each team, being ordered from best to worst by their percentage throughout the season.
As of this season, the names of the knockout stages were modified as follows: Round of 32, Round of 16, Quarter-finals, Semifinals, Zone Final and Final, this as a consequence of the division of the country into two zones, for so the teams only face clubs from the same region until the final series. 
Round of 32.
The first legs were played on 26 and 27 May, and the second legs were played on 29 and 30 May 2021. 
Round of 16.
The first legs were played on 2 and 3 June, and the second legs were played on 5 and 6 June 2021. 
Final stage.
Zone Quarter–finals.
The first legs were played on 9 and 10 June, and the second legs were played on 12 and 13 June 2021.
Zone Semi–finals.
The first legs were played on 16 June, and the second legs were played on 19 June 2021.
Zone Finals.
The first legs were played on 23 and 24 June, and the second legs were played on 26 and 27 June 2021.
League Final.
The match was played on 3 July 2021.
Reserve and Development Teams.
Each season a table is created among those teams that don't have the right to promote, because they are considered as reserve teams for teams that play in <a href="Liga%20MX">Liga MX</a>, <a href="Liga%20de%20Expansi%C3%B3n%20MX">Liga de Expansión</a> and <a href="Liga%20Premier%20de%20M%C3%A9xico">Liga Premier</a> or are independent teams that have requested not to participate for the Promotion due to the fact that they are footballers development projects. The ranking order is determined through the "quotient", which is obtained by dividing the points obtained between the disputed matches, being ordered from highest to lowest.
Play–offs.
Round of 16.
The first legs were played on 26 May, and the second legs were played on 29 May 2021. 
Quarter–finals.
The first legs were played on 2 June, and the second legs were played on 5 June 2021. 
Semi-finals.
The first legs were played on 9 and 10 June, and the second legs were played on 12 and 13 June 2021. 
Final.
The first leg was played on 17 June, and the second leg was played on 20 June 2021. 
Regular Season statistics.
Top goalscorers.
Players sorted first by goals scored, then by last name.
Source:<a href="http%3A//ligatdp.mx/tablagoleo">Liga TDP</a>
